body.plain: BHP is the process, our external customers and shareholders receive the output of our process. By focussing on the process (our company) we will continue to deliver exceptional outcomes. People design and execute our processes, it makes sense then that we then prioritise them as our primary value creating asset. How are we developing and challenging our teams? BOS promotes a new way of working that helps engage and get the best out of team members.

body.plain:
Estimados (as),
¿Cómo están?
Aprovecho esta instancia para felicitar a todo el equipo de la VPProjects y en especial a los profesionales que han trabajado en el proyecto 6to Peralte a lo largo de la vida de éste, desde la etapa de estudio hasta su actual etapa de ejecución, ha sido un largo camino con desafíos permanentes, que con el apoyo de las Funciones y Operaciónes (NPI&CHO), hemos alcanzado importantes hitos como el comisionamiento de la nueva Torre de Captación, nuevo Ramal Norte y el sellado de los pozos en el sector del muro. Estamos próximos a terminar con el peraltamiento del muro, último hito, que permitirá sustentar el Valor de Escondida a través de la continuidad operacional de las concentradores. Los invito a seguir perseverando con seguridad para alcanzar la meta final, con el espíritu colaborativo propiciando la inclusión y diversidad.

Saludos y que tengan un buen fin de semana.
#somoselcambio #wearitpurple

messages.content_excerpt:
Estimados (as),
¿Cómo están?
Aprovecho esta instancia para felicitar a todo el equipo de la VPProjects y en especial a los profesionales que han trabajado en el proyecto 6to Peralte a lo largo de la vida de éste, desde la etapa de estudio hasta su actual etapa de ejecución, ha sido un largo camino con desafíos permanentes, que con el apoyo de las Funciones y Operaciónes (NPI&CHO), hemos alcanzado importantes hitos como el comisionamiento de la nueva Torre de Captación, nuevo Ramal Norte y el sellado de los pozos en el sector del muro. Estamos próximos a terminar con el peraltamiento del muro, último hito, que permitirá sustentar el Valor de Escondida a través de la continuidad operacional de las concentradores. Los invito a seguir perseverando con seguridad para alcanzar la meta final, con el espíritu colaborativo propiciando la inclusión y diversidad.

Saludos y que tengan un buen fin de semana.
#somoselcambio #wearitpurple

body.plain:
En linea con la mejora continua y la excelencia operacional se refuerzan cada día más las dinamicas de BOS con los dialogos de desempeño en la Superintendencia Lixiviación de Sulfuros de la Gerencia General de Cátodos dando el punta pie inicial el circulo de calidad "Los Pingo Pingo"

Una metodologia que nos motiva a desafiar nuestros procesos para ser más seguros y eficientes!

#bosinaction

#vamosjuntos

Morales, Hector M Alfaro, Olga Valdebenito, Ricardo RJ Morales, Estefania Miranda, Heidy Paola Cespedes, Juan JG (Planta) Tata, Aurenic Perez, Camila Gutierrez, Ricardo Sepulveda, Juan Villavicencio, Sandra Hormazabal, Yasna Portilla, Felipe Alberto

body.plain:
Hola a tod@s, con agrado les comparto el mejoramiento que realizamos como turno P-1 Superintendencia EW-2, a nuestros colegas de la Superintendencia Oxidos, en el marco de cooperación entre áreas, aportando con una "alfombra sanitaria" para el cuidado de nuestros colegas ante la pandemia COVID 19. Destacamos la preocupación y acción crónica en seguridad por parte del círculo de calidad "Le Cangre" en que soy parte y poder participar en el cuidado para que todos lleguemos sanos a casa.

#estepartidologanamostodos

Destacamos la preocupación y acción crónica en seguridad por parte del círculo de calidad "Le Cangre" en que soy parte y poder participar en el cuidado para que todos lleguemos sanos a casa.

body.plain:
During some Field Leadership it was identified that Trevor Hazelwood from Peak Downs Mine was doing an excellent job at being his own safety officer. He was not only looking after himself but also his fellow team members. Trev identified that a ramp from the dump had been over watered. He called the next truck to wait at the top of the ramp and informed the other trucks to wait on the dump until he was able to cut a dry line. Well done Trev in having the confidence to close a circuit until it could be made safe!!

cc: Ziekenheiner, Arie, Scott, Dean

He called the next truck to wait at the top of the ramp and informed the other trucks to wait on the dump until he was able to cut a dry line. Well done Trev in having the confidence to close a circuit until it could be made safe!!

cc: Ziekenheiner, Arie, Scott, Dean

body.plain:
Mastery Virtual Reality is one step closer to reality

With Western Australian travel restrictions easing I finally got the opportunity to test the proof of concept Mastery virtual reality program at Yandi this week.
Based on high end gaming technology, this prototype program gives the user the ability to view haul truck cycles from a third person view with the ability to move from overhead view, to in cab, and even ground level perspectives. Whilst the program was originally designed to be used for Mastery coaching and formal verifications the potential for inclusion in operator training was very quickly realised. Theres some work to do to get to deployment stage but initial feedback was overwhelmingly positive. Some comments below:

NTI Haul Truck – 4 months exp • I wish this had been available when I started as it makes everything so clear. To be able to look in the mirror, see the view from the digger, pause and watch the trucks cycle is amazing. It’s Mastery in action. I love it.

Experienced Haul Tuck Operator - 10 years exp • Some of the content in that scenario took me 2 years to learn. If I could have seen that when I first started driving trucks, it would have made things much easier. As an in cab trainer, I can see how much of a difference this will make for new operators.

Experienced Loader/Haul Truck Operator - 8 years exp • That is incredible. We need this now! So may benefits for training of new operators and for clearly explaining the Mastery Standards. Ive actually leaned a lot about why Mastery is what it is and what good looks like.

references.content_excerpt:
Mastery Virtual Reality is one step closer to reality

With Western Australian travel restrictions easing I finally got the opportunity to test the proof of concept Mastery virtual reality program at Yandi this week.
Based on high end gaming technology, this prototype program gives the user the ability to view haul truck cycles from a third person view with the ability to move from overhead view, to in cab, and even ground level perspectives. Whilst the program was originally designed to be used for Mastery coaching and formal verifications the potential for inclusion in operator training was very quickly realised. Theres some work to do to get to deployment stage but initial feedback was overwhelmingly positive. Some comments below:

NTI Haul Truck – 4 months exp • I wish this had been available when I started as it makes everything so clear. To be able to look in the mirror, see the view from the digger, pause and watch the trucks cycle is amazing. It’s Mastery in action. I love it.

Experienced Haul Tuck Operator - 10 years exp • Some of the content in that scenario took me 2 years to learn. If I could have seen that when I first started driving trucks, it would have made things much easier. As an in cab trainer, I can see how much of a difference this will make for new operators.

Experienced Loader/Haul Truck Operator - 8 years exp • That is incredible. We need this now! So may benefits for training of new operators and for clearly explaining the Mastery Standards. Ive actually leaned a lot about why Mastery is what it is and what good looks like.

body.plain:
Good Day Everyone - a little note about July 27.

So what’s significant about July 27 (18 days ago) Let me tell you….
· No one really interesting was born… or died for that matter
· At a news conference Donald Trump expressed hope the Russians would recover Hillary’s emails
· JULY 27, 2015 – TJ Hara started with BHP

So this note is officially 18 days late… Something must have happened in the system during the transition between Simon, Lisa and I and this was missed.

To quote Colin James “It’s been five long years and I love you just the same” … and by “long” we mean “awesome” and by “I love you just the same” we mean “we really appreciate you being part of the team”.

I don’t think I have to tell you how valued TJ is to the Project Services team. His calm and collected demeanor sets him apart from all the other frazzled and reactive personalities he calls his project services colleagues. His knowledge and experience in estimating and range analysis has earned him a great deal of respect by all who have worked with him, internal and external to Potash.

TJ – Congratulations on your 5 Years and 18 Days anniversary with BHP, I look forward to working beside you for many more years and 18 days.

Thank you TJ.

Peter Goodger

cc: Hara, TJ, Hoadley, Simon, Dimen, Lisa

I don’t think I have to tell you how valued TJ is to the Project Services team. Peter Goodger

body.plain:
Spent some time the last couple of days at the Future Fit Academy in Mackay helping complete authorisations with some of the Pathway Supervisors for move and test.

Great to see how the academy workshop is set up and see where the future apprentices are acquiring their skill set to secure a future in this industry.

Was great to meet another department! Thanks Smith, Melissa & English, Sharelle

👷🏻‍♀️😊🙌🏼

#bhp #os #oneteam #future #fitacademy

Was great to meet another department! Thanks Smith, Melissa & English, Sharelle

👷🏻‍♀️😊🙌🏼

#bhp #os #oneteam #future #fitacademy

body.plain:
Our third Miro 101 training session was held yesterday and can now be viewed here:
https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/ced36a84-8978-4126-abbc-effe7aaabd77

A big thanks to the 160 BHP users who listened to Morgan and Andrew from Miro<https://miro.com> take us through the basic features, provide a great how-to session and answer questions from the audience.

Previous session recordings can be found here<https://web.microsoftstream.com/browse?q=miro>. Shorter tutorials are also available for the time-poor among us. Please have a look at the Miro Academy<https://academy.miro.com/> to get started.

Our next session will be hosted in 2-3 weeks. This time, we will begin looking at some specific use cases and advanced tips and tricks. If you are new to Miro, we recommend you watch one of the Miro 101 sessions before joining this one.

body.plain:
Excelente inicio a nuestro ciclo de mesas de trabajo para este FY con nuestros Departamentos HSE de empresas colaboradoras de Escondida BHP, en esta ocasión hemos logrado definir a nuestro primer equipo "Champion" para trabajar con foco en Eventos Significativos y calidad de Hazard. Con esto damos un nuevo paso en la integración y trabajo en equipo a través de nuestro plan de Seguridad Conjunto. Este equipo esta compuesto por 12 de nuestras empresas y a la brevedad se iniciarán las sesiones de trabajo, analisis y por sobre todo la entrega de la visión desde distintos enfoques. Solo podemos agradecer el compromiso y la dispocisión. TEAMWORK!!!
Avanzamos Todos by Safety!!!!

cc: Ellis, Laila, Fuentes, Yerko, Piña, Jaime Eduardo, Trigo, Marcos, Godoy, Francisco, Neves, Mauro, Navarrete, Pablo PP, Carvajal, Oscar OA, Cornejo, Ronny, Varas, Lorena LE, Ramirez, Giovanni, Astudillo, Domingo, Vega, Fernando Alejandro, Crisosto, Angelo, Dubo, Wladimir, Fernandez, Flavio F, Caceres, Claudia, Rojas, Ricardo, Caballero, Rodrigo, Morales, Hector M, Caceres, Luis, Tapia, Alejandro AG, Castillo, Marcelo MA

body.plain:
Durante este año en la Gerencia de Ingeniería Integrada de Escondida hemos trabajado en la implementación de Process Safety, una mezcla de habilidades de ingeniería, gestión y personas, que tienen por objetivo aportar a la seguridad de los trabajadores en la operación. El proceso está enfocado en prevenir accidentes graves asociados a la pérdida de contención primaria de sustancias peligrosas, que puedan provocar una fatalidad.
Te invitamos a conocer Process Safety y cómo será implementado en Escondida para prevenir la ocurrencia de incidentes (ver afiche adjunto).

cc: Lemin, Marcus, Retamal, Nibaldo, Reyes, Leandro, Apablaza, Jorge, Neves, Mauro, Castillo, Marcelo MA, Mereu, Leandro, Fuentes, Yerko, Bustos, Juan Pablo, Silva, Hector, Claveria, Nelson, Zaffiri, Gino, Morales, Hector M, Caballero, Rodrigo, Tapia, Alejandro AG, Raventos, Alex, Gonzalez, Irina, Maggiolo, Romina, De Castro, Aline, Yañez, Alvaro, Gonzalez, Cristhian, Mendez, Felipe, Rojas, Flavia FX Ximena, Gonzalez, Evelyn, Montoya, Luis, Quiñones, Cristian CA, Abreu, Carolina, Aroca, Mirka, Ormazabal, Sidney, Moraga, German, Perez, Rodrigo, Piña, Jaime Eduardo

body.plain:
Talking technology | Building solutions in line with BHP’s Data Strategy by Jones, Michael
We bring you another exciting talk this month!

Learn more about our Data Strategy, Guidance and Technologies to support our business outcomes.

Upcoming talks
- Building solutions in line with BHP’s Data Strategy (August)
- Next Generation Integration capability at BHP (September)
- Design Systems: Accelerating Product Design & Development (October)
Watch recorded sessions at https://spo.bhpbilliton.com/sites/ArchitectureChapter/SitePages/talking-technology.aspx

Email us at DL-Tech-All-Secure-GlobalArchitecture to join the mailing list.

Looking for speakers
Share your experience and improve your public speaking experience! You could talk about, Your current project, lessons learnt or challenges overcome , Interesting technology you have read or tried or Share technology videos and high light key sections.

Email us at DL-Tech-All-Secure-GlobalArchitecture to register your interest today!

cc: Finn, Nathan, Tapia, Maximiliano, Li, Susan, Borse, Archie, Leen, Thomas, Weidner, Lauren, Tan, Shihong, Vaghjiani, Kamal, Miller, Leeane, Jones, Paul, Smith, Alyssa, Chai, Patrick, Davis, Lesley, Turner, Martin
